title: can not authenticate via ldap
body:
expected behavior
users to authenticate via ldap

actual behavior
users get invalid password error

steps to reproduce
ldap app enabled and configured as such on admin page:


![ldap_1](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/5174383/988157/dfbc5dcc-08fb-11e3-9550-bdea69dc48b7.png)


![ldap_2](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/5174383/988158/e2adf810-08fb-11e3-9283-0b5f8ad72e8d.png)
![ldap_3](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/5174383/988159/e44a57d6-08fb-11e3-948f-708c5e1e3aee.png)
![ldap_4](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/5174383/988160/e7362862-08fb-11e3-9851-50d3eb9a63d8.png)








however, according to the expert tab in the ldap configuration, by default, owncloud autodetects the uuid attribute.  to overwrite it, enter something in the box.  the box, as you can see from the captures above, is blank.


users are unable to log into owncloud with this configuration.

note: we have other lab boxes configured the same way and users can authenticate without issue.
the log shows the following:



{"app":"user_ldap","message":"illegal value for the uuid attribute, reset to autodetect.","level":1,"time":"2013-08-19t15:59:55+00:00"}

server configuration
{"installed":"true","version":"5.0.15","versionstring":"5.0.10"}
linux ubuntu, php5.4
